status.text: Rules Committee relieved of further consideration.  Placed on second reading.

original.text:
H-0257.1
HOUSE BILL 1090
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByRepresentatives Alvarado, Parshley, Ryu, Ramel, Berry, Reed, Fitzgibbon, Taylor, Macri, Callan, Obras, Farivar, Doglio, Fosse, Ortiz-Self, Simmons, Peterson, Goodman, Wylie, Pollet, Kloba, Duerr, Berg, Ormsby, Lekanoff, Salahuddin, Stonier, Reeves, Bernbaum, Tharinger, and Hill
Prefiled 12/18/24.Read first time 01/13/25.Referred to Committee on Health Care & Wellness.
AN ACT Relating to contraceptive coverage; amending RCW 48.43.195; and providing an effective date.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
Sec. 1. RCW 48.43.195 and 2017 c 293 s 2 are each amended to read as follows:
(1) A health benefit plan issued or renewed on or after January 1, ((2018))2026, that includes coverage for contraceptive drugs must provide reimbursement for a ((twelve-month refill))12-month supply of contraceptive drugs obtained at one time by the enrollee, unless the enrollee requests a smaller supply or the prescribing provider instructs that the enrollee must receive a smaller supply. The health plan must allow enrollees to receive the contraceptive drugs on-site at the provider's office, if available. Any dispensing practices required by the plan must follow clinical guidelines for appropriate prescribing and dispensing to ensure the health of the patient while maximizing access to effective contraceptive drugs.
(2) Nothing in this section prohibits a health plan from limiting refills that may be obtained in the last quarter of the plan year if a ((twelve-month))12-month supply of the contraceptive drug has already been dispensed during the plan year.
(3) For purposes of this section, "contraceptive drugs" means all drugs approved by the United States food and drug administration that are used to prevent pregnancy, including, but not limited to, hormonal drugs administered orally, transdermally, and intravaginally.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 2. This act takes effect January 1, 2026.
--- END ---

summary.text:
Purpose

The purpose of this bill is to update the requirements for health benefit plans regarding coverage for contraceptive drugs in Washington State. The key change is the mandate for these plans to provide a 12-month supply of contraceptive drugs to enrollees. This update aims to enhance access to contraceptive methods and ensure that patients can obtain their prescriptions more conveniently.

Key Provisions

Coverage Requirements

  • Health benefit plans issued or renewed on or after January 1, 2026, must reimburse for a 12-month supply of contraceptive drugs if obtained at one time by the enrollee.
  • Enrollees may opt for a smaller supply if requested or if directed by their prescribing provider.
  • Plans must allow for on-site dispensing of contraceptive drugs at the provider's office when available.
  • Dispensing practices must align with clinical guidelines to promote patient health and access to effective contraceptive methods.

Limitations on Refills

  • Health plans may limit refills in the last quarter of the plan year if a 12-month supply has already been dispensed during that year.

keywords.text: coverage requirements contraceptive drugs enrollees supply access prescriptions dispensing practices refills health plans effective methods
